intro: Heracleum jacquemontii, commonly known as the mountain hogweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its tall, hollow stems and large, compound leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky soils. Due to its toxic sap, it requires caution when handling.
